issue.body:
New type of YouTube ads is blocked by our filters. If that does not help, try using our script by following the instructions below.

---

Please enable AdGuard Extra in AdGuard settings (for app users).

---

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
It looks like that problem is not related to filters and SSL certificate for `127.0.0.1` (which I guess is installed and used by this plugin) isn't trusted by the browser when AdGuard is used.

<details><summary>Screenshots</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29142494/209076516-7fca5046-6588-4b4b-935a-a0aca2f2bd55.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29142494/209076531-844a5d6d-d322-4726-8cc5-3b4ec36933c1.png)

</details>

Could you please try to open AdGuard's settings and in `General Settings` go to `Advanced Settings` and disable `Filter localhost` option and then save settings (like on a screenshots below)?

<details><summary>Screenshots</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29142494/209076784-00641a2b-ac0d-48fa-8eac-3e9f9c31439f.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29142494/209076794-5e2578ba-9dae-4c1f-b54e-45513807567e.png)

</details>

Or you can also try to add `127.0.0.1` to HTTPS exclusions - Settings -> `Network` tab - HTTPS filtering section - `Exclusions` (screenshots below).

<details><summary>Screenshots</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29142494/209077085-c1d5f01e-ee1d-413c-96c8-78c667519928.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29142494/209077094-29b7adfe-dcf8-4c16-9bd2-5a349497293d.png)

</details>

comment.body:
Z tego co widzę, to tylko w wersji mobilnej to przewijanie jest (nadal nie chcę tego blokować, bo uważam, że może być przydatne, zawsze można kliknąć ikonkę domku na dole, strona zostanie przeładowana i nie zostanie przewinięta).

Ta reguła powinna działać:
```adblock
interia.pl#%#//scriptlet('set-constant', 'Inpl.IntScroll', 'noopFunc')
```
ale widzę, że jest jakiś błąd w konsoli, więc nie wiem czy czegoś nie będzie psuło, więc ewentualnie coś takiego:
```adblock
interia.pl#%#//scriptlet('set-constant', 'Object.prototype.scrollBlock', 'noopFunc')
```

issue.title: Roxy sites - Broken (AdGuard Annoyances filter) [GDPR]

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin v1.45.2

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other(specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.roxy.fi/
https://www.roxy.fr/
https://www.roxy-denmark.dk/ 
https://www.roxy-ireland.ie/
https://www.roxy-store.se/
https://www.roxy-uk.co.uk/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Annoyances filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

### Affected sites:
```
https://www.roxy.fi/
https://www.roxy.fr/
https://www.roxy-denmark.dk/ 
https://www.roxy-ireland.ie/
https://www.roxy-store.se/
https://www.roxy-uk.co.uk/
```

### Issue:
Modal overlay / missing scrollbar

### Screenshots:
Not needed, as the problem is obvious.

### Problem filter:
* **AdGuard Annoyances filter**

### Problem rules:
`###cookie-popup`
`##.cookie-popup:not(body):not(html)`

### Possible fix:
```
roxy.fi,roxy.fr,roxy-denmark.dk,roxy-ireland.ie,roxy-store.se,roxy-uk.co.uk#@##cookie-popup
roxy.fi,roxy.fr,roxy-denmark.dk,roxy-ireland.ie,roxy-store.se,roxy-uk.co.uk#@#.cookie-popup:not(body):not(html)
```
PS:
Blocking the modal overlay, with an additional stylesheet overflow rule, doesn't seem to work in this case, as it results in broken functions (e.g. the shopping cart can't be opened).

### Other problem filters:
* **Easylist Cookie List** / **Fanboy's Annoyance List** https://github.com/easylist/easylist/issues/14467/
`##div.cookie-popup`
`##div#cookie-popup`

* **I don't care about cookies** _(NOTIFIED)_
`~adtipp.de,~handelsregister.de,~bk.com###cookie-popup`
`~bintercanarias.com##.ui-widget[aria-labelledby*="cookie"]`
`~ejot.de,~ejot.at,~ejot.cn,~ejot.co.uk,~goteborg.com,~openreach.com,~argenta.be##.cookie-popup:not(body):not(html):not(#colorbox):not(.ant-modal-wrap)`

--

### System info:
* OS/version: Windows 10 Pro 21H2 (x64)
* Browser/version: LibreWolf v108.0.1-1 (x64) (Tracking Protection = Standard)
* Adblock Extension/version: uBlock Origin v1.45.2

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://downdetector.com/status/youtube/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdowndetector.com%2Fstatus%2Fyoutube%2F) ### Comment Username: @d0x360 > The social media feed is also missing. Adding the following brings the comments section back but I don't think it should be blocked anyway... > > @@||downdetectorapi.com/v2/companies/*/messages/current$domain=downdetectorapi.com > > The wildcard is the site identifier (YouTube in this case) which is a string of numbers so a wildcard seemed easier than adding every site I might check in the future but I don't know why disqus is blocked. > > I understand it can be used to track but it seems like blocking it should be the user rule instead of unblocking since it's not on most websites. > > ### Screenshots
